description: Nonprimes such that n and phi(n) are relatively prime.
comments: Also nonprimes n such that there is only one group of order n, i.e., A000001(n) = 1.Intersection of A018252 and A003277.Also numbers n such that n and A051953(n) are relatively prime. - _Labos Elemer_Apart from the first term, this is a subsequence of A024556. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 15 2015
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Select[Range[450], !PrimeQ[#] && GCD[#, EulerPhi[#]] == 1&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 31 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) is(n)=!isprime(n) && gcd(eulerphi(n),n)==1 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 15 2015
crossrefs: If the primes are included we get A003277. Cf. A000001, A000010 (phi).
author: _Christian G. Bower_, Nov 15 1999
